item.title: Okay, So What's VOTOMS?
item.content:encoded: <i>VOTOMS</i> is always waiting to be discovered, as a story that has been continually added to for decades, with a style and vibe that speak to anyone who likes their robots just a little more <i>real</i>.

item.title: Yoroi-Shinden Samurai Troopers ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: Their base may currently be on rails, but the plotting of <i>Yoroi-Shinden Samurai Troopers</i> feels like it's jumping the tracks sometimes.

item.title: Isekai Office Worker: The Other World's Books Depend on the Bean Counter ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: In another series, Aresh would come across as a walking red flag. But within the context of <i>this</i> series, Aresh is painted more as overwhelmed with concern for a man who seems hell-bent on self-destruction.

item.title: Honō no Tōkyūjo: Dodge Danko Dodgeball Anime Unveils Cast, Staff
item.content:encoded: Manaka Nakayama, Kaori Maeda, Akira Sekine, Yō Taichi, Yū Sasahara star in CUE show

item.content:encoded: 2nd season's cast, staff return for upcoming season

item.title: Crunchyroll to Stream One PIece TV Anime's Elbaph Arc
item.content:encoded: New arc begins on April 5

item.title: Tao Tsuchiya Guest-Stars in 2026 Anpanman Film as Red Panda
item.content:encoded: <i>Alice in Borderland</i> star plays Pantan on journey with Anpanman in June 26 film

item.title: PARANORMASIGHT: The Mermaid's Curse Game Review
item.content:encoded: While its story elements come together in a snug, fantastical narrative, the first entry's gameplay shortcomings remain, and this new game's shift away from spookier, creepier plot beats left me wanting.

item.title: Journal with Witch ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: The notion of motherhood hangs over the entirety of <em>Journal with Witch</em>, like uncertain clouds that might unleash a torrent of rain at any moment.

item.title: Hell's Paradise Season 2 ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: I have to be honest, I'm not really sure how they're going to get out of this situation given the way the episode ends.

item.title: My Hero Academia: Vigilantes Season 2 ‒ Episode 20
item.content:encoded: I want to make it clear that I didn't hate this episode...but.

item.title: Golden Kamuy Final Season ‒ Episode 56
item.content:encoded: As the end draws near, it’s never been less certain where some of <i>Golden Kamuy</i>’s characters stand, and there’s no telling quite how this powder keg will blow!

item.title: Wash It All Away ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: This episode’s social media-centric premise was stretched out a little bit too thin for me.

item.title: Holy Boy Novel Review
item.content:encoded: I can already tell <i>Holy Boy</i> is one of those titles that is going to stay with me for a long time. When I first began reading it, I realized I’d need to close the covers or else I’d be up all night following its characters into the most unsettling recesses of their distorted minds.

item.title: Hana-Kimi ‒ Episode 8
item.content:encoded: Without Umeda around, I suppose <i>someone</i> has to be the one to point out to Mizuki that she's being silly.

item.title: You and I Are Polar Opposites ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: Miyu's reunion with her “ex” isn't exactly high-stakes melodrama, but for a show as fluffy as this one, it might as well be

item.title: This Week in Anime - Gatchaman Standing Out in CROWDS Waving their Insights
item.content:encoded: This week, Coop and Sylvia take a look at 2013 anime <i>Gatchaman Crowds</i>, and its sequel—which predicted the future we're now living in.

item.title: Frieren: Beyond Journey's End Season 2 ‒ Episode 5
item.content:encoded: I think we've all had a time or two in our lives where we're left facing the hard decision of which would be worse: ruining somebody's fun or letting them be disappointed in the end.

item.title: Fate/strange Fake ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: "Philia" could well be the most dangerous wild card in this entire Grail War.

item.title: Aniplex Appoints International Business Head Shu Nishimoto as New President
item.content:encoded: Nishimoto to replace Atsuhiro Iwakami, who will become Sony Music Entertainment president

item.title: Gnosia ‒ Episode 18
item.content:encoded: Okay, we can all agree that there's no way that this is the real ending of Gnosia, right?

item.title: I Played the Never-to-be-Released Danganronpa 2x2 Special Trial Version
item.content:encoded: Made specifically for the Danganronpa 15th Anniversary Event, this short, 15-minute vertical slice was designed to give the most hardcore Danagaronpa fans an original mystery never to be seen again.

item.title: Golden Kamuy Anime Announces Additional Cast for Final Arc
item.content:encoded: Shizuka Ito voices character in February 23 episode

item.title: There's No Freaking Way I'll Be Your Lover! Unless… ~Next Shine~ Episodes 13-17 Anime Review
item.content:encoded: Originally, the series was a bit unclear about why Renako was in denial or always quick to run away from the romantic advances of others. This arc makes it explicitly clear that she does not think she is a good person who is deserving of any of that love.

item.title: Your Anime Rankings - Best of Winter 2026, Feb 5-11
item.content:encoded: Despite starting second from the bottom with middling reviews, <cite>The Villainess Is Adored by the Prince of the Neighbor Kingdom</cite> has surged to #5 this week. Consider my curiosity well and truly piqued by this week’s rankings.

item.title: Lovely Angels Done Dirty? The Dirty Pair Kickstarter Saga
item.content:encoded: Dirty Pair fans came out of the woodwork to back this project—to the tune of US$731,406 what they got were years of delays, authoring problems, and a disc wrapped in a napkin. What happened?

item.title: The Invisible Man and His Soon-to-Be Wife ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: There's no point in being jealous about something that you can't have or of someone that you aren't, because all it does is distract from the fact that you can still lead a happy and fulfilling life as you are.

item.title: Sentenced to Be a Hero ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: The sub-theme of the two of things being more alike than different, and that being the source of Xylo’s angst, is a compelling one, something I hope the show explores more of in the future.

item.title: Firefly Wedding Volumes 2-4 Manga Review

item.title: Singer Hikaru Utada's Son Makes Dragon Ball Discovery, 36 Years Later
item.content:encoded: Utada's son: "Goku said 'Ore'" once — before he went Super Saiyan

item.title: Ghost in the Shell Director Mamoru Oshii Logs Over 8,000 Hours in Fallout 4
item.content:encoded: Oshii also recalls his hours playing <i>Death Stranding, PUBG, Virtua Fighter</i>

item.title: Seven Seas Licenses More There's No Freaking Way I'll be Your Lover! Unless... & I'm in Love with the Villainess Stories, 3 Yuri Manga
item.content:encoded: Also licensed: <cite>A Couple Drifting in the Wind</cite>, <cite>Sleeping Idiot, A Love Yet to Bloom </cite>

item.title: 2nd Live-Action Mr. Osomatsu Film Reveals 3 More Cast Members
item.content:encoded: Eiichirō Funakoshi, Yudai Chiba, Hitomi Miyauchi play scientists key to film's plot

item.title: Dead Mount Death Play Side Story Manga Listed as Ending with 5th Volume
item.content:encoded: 5th volume ships on April 24

item.title: Manta Comics Opens Global Submissions for New Creator Program
item.content:encoded: Platform offers pay-per-episode or hybrid model that combines subscriptions with pay-per-episode

item.title: Live-Action Yamaguchi-kun Isn't So Bad Film Reveals 2 Cast Members
item.content:encoded: Film casts Hikaru Takahashi as Satsuki Shinohara, Yо̄ji Iwase as Rion Ishizaki

item.title: Actor James Van Der Beek Dies at 48
item.content:encoded: Actor played Dawson in <cite>Dawson's Creek</cite>, Pazu in <cite>Castle in the Sky</cite>

item.title: Artist Sankaku Head Ends Weekly Serialization Pace
item.content:encoded: <cite>Himouto! Umaru-chan</cite> artist cited age, children for decision

item.title: Monika Kaname's Hakoiri Ojō-sama to Shominna Ore no Yaritai 100 no Koto Manga Ends
item.content:encoded: Manga's 2nd volume releases on March 6

item.title: You and I Are Polar Opposites ‒ Episode 5
item.content:encoded: Between the antics our central couple and the potential new ones looming over the horizon it looks like the show has plenty of ways to help keep its formula fresh.

item.title: Wataru Midori's Kagami no Kuni no Shitateya Manga Ends
item.content:encoded: Series debuted as one-shot in 2024

item.title: Sentai Filmworks Screens World Premiere of 4K Restoration of Ninja Scroll Anime Film at Berlinale
item.content:encoded: Following 1st screenings in February, Sentai will release film in 4K UHD in early 2027

item.title: Yoroi-Shinden Samurai Troopers ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: It's a suitably dramatic escalation to arrive at, and it's almost immediately undercut by <i>Samurai Troopers</i> reminding viewers that it is still, in fact, a cartoon.

item.title: Yonoi Tsukihiko's Happy Hell Manga Ends in Next Volume
item.content:encoded: 8th volume shipped on Monday

item.title: Journal with Witch ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: Before this episode aired, I didn't know it was possible for me to feel ponytail envy. Now I do.

item.title: Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Game Adds Super Monkey Ball's AiAi on February 11
item.content:encoded: The official X/Twitter account for Sega's Sonic Racing CrossWorlds racing game announced on Tuesday that it is adding AiAi from Super Monkey Ball in a...

item.title: Hell's Paradise Season 2 ‒ Episode 5
item.content:encoded: OK, raise your hand if you genuinely thought that our band of misfits weren't running into a trap!

item.title: Usamaru Furuya Launches New Manga on April 11
item.content:encoded: <cite>Yumeji Ehon</cite> manga takes place in Taishō era
